articles.author: Nidal Al-Mughrabi
articles.description: Israeli air strikes killed at least 50 Palestinians in Gaza, local health authorities said, as Israel continues its bombardment despite mounting international pressure to stop military operations and allow aid into Gaza unimpeded.
articles.title: Israeli strikes kill dozens in Gaza as criticism of Israel grows

articles.author: Julia Payne
articles.description: The EU adopted four sets of sanctions against Russia over the war in Ukraine on Tuesday, including a 17th package targeting Moscow's shadow fleet, and measures related to chemical weapons, human rights and hybrid threats, the European Commission said on Tuesday.
articles.title: EU countries adopt four sets of new Russia sanctions

articles.author: Reuters
articles.description: Iran received and is reviewing a proposal for a fifth round of nuclear talks with the United States, Deputy Foreign Minister Kazem Gharibabadi said on Tuesday, according to state media.
articles.title: Iran reviewing proposal for 5th round of nuclear talks

articles.author: Reuters
articles.description: Pakistan said on Wednesday it had agreed to deepen trade and investment with China, days after the end of a deadly conflict with India that Beijing urged should be resolved through dialogue.
articles.title: Pakistan, China agree to deepen trade, maintain close communication

articles.author: Nevzat Devranoglu
articles.description: Turkey is in talks with Canada's Candu Energy and other companies regarding plans to build its second and third nuclear power plants, Turkish Energy Minister Alparslan Bayraktar said.
articles.title: Turkey in nuclear plant talks with Candu, energy minister says

articles.author: Suleiman Al-Khalidi, Timour Azhari
articles.description: Syria's leadership approved the handover of the belongings of long-dead spy Eli Cohen to Israel in a bid to ease Israeli hostility and show goodwill to U.S. President Donald Trump, three sources told Reuters.
articles.title: Exclusive: Syrian leadership approved return of dead spy archive to Israel, sources say

articles.author: Tom Balmforth, Andreas Rinke, John Irish
articles.description: For Ukraine and its allies, who spent months trying to win Donald Trump over to their cause in the war started by Russia, it is back to square one.
articles.title: Trump-Putin call on war in Ukraine is another blow to Kyiv and its allies

articles.author: David Lawder, Promit Mukherjee
articles.description: Finance ministers from the Group of Seven industrial democracies will try to agree on policies to restore global growth and stability, Canadian Finance Minister Francois-Philippe Champagne said on Tuesday, acknowledging that tensions over new U.S. tariffs would continue.
articles.title: Canada says G7 finance ministers to focus on restoring stability, growth

articles.author: Daniel Ramos
articles.description: The registration window for candidates hoping to compete for Bolivia's presidency in its August election expired on Tuesday, drawing a line under ex-President Evo Morales' attempt at a fourth presidential term.
articles.title: Evo Morales out of Bolivian presidential race as candidate deadline expires

articles.author: Manuela Andreoni, Alexander Villegas
articles.description: Massive fires fueled by climate change led global forest loss to smash records in 2024, according to a report issued on Wednesday.
articles.title: Amazon fires drive unprecedented global forest loss in 2024, report says
